thread.title: Oil Prices End Down on Profit-Taking

author: Christopher Alessi
title: Oil Prices End Down on Profit-Taking
text:
Oil prices fell Friday, stalling after surging to more-than-three-year highs after President Donald Trumpâ€™s decision to pull the U.S. out of the Iran nuclear deal.
U.S. crude futures settled down 66 cents, or 0.92%, at $70.70 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange. Brent, the global benchmark, fell 35 cents, or 0.45%, to $77.12 a barrel on ICE Futures Europe
Prices...
